question.title: Getting the vnet of an Azure Kubernetes cluster via SDK
question.body:
I am trying to get the vnet of an Azure Kubernetes cluster via the SDK. This can be done easily via the command line:

az aks show --resource-group <resource_group_name> --name <cluster_name> --query "networkProfile"

I am trying to do the same via this via the networkProfile. However, there is no vNet attribute:

val azureKubernetesClusters = azure.kubernetesClusters()
for (k <- azureKubernetesClusters.list().asScala) {
   k.innerModel().networkProfile().vnet() <- This won't compile    
  }

Is there a quick/easy way to get the vnet of an Azure Kubernetes cluster via the SDK?

EDIT: I realized it can be done this way:

for (pool <- k.innerModel().agentPoolProfiles().asScala) { val subnet = pool.vnetSubnetId()}

answers.body:
I was able to find the vnet by looking at the agent profiles:

for (pool <- k.innerModel().agentPoolProfiles().asScala) { 
val subnet = pool.vnetSubnetId()
}

question_comments.body: Is your issue resolved? If yes, please provide it as an answer to benefit the SO community.
